stem: A 42-year-old violinist develops finger and thumb extension weakness without sensory deficits. Resisted supination reproduces lateral forearm pain. Which structure most likely compresses the affected nerve?
rationale_correct: Posterior interosseous nerve syndrome is typically caused by entrapment beneath the arcade of Frohse, producing motor deficits without sensory loss.

rationale_distractors.B: Brachioradialis fascia is not a common entrapment site for the radial nerve.
rationale_distractors.C: Flexor digitorum superficialis arch compresses the median nerve, not radial.
rationale_distractors.D: Pronator teres entrapment affects the median nerve (pronator syndrome).
rationale_distractors.E: The cubital tunnel retinaculum involves the ulnar nerve.
